channel.title: BrainPowered Biz Radio | Blog Talk Radio Feed
channel.description: Brainchild Associates, an Atlanta-based PR and marketing firm, has launched BrainPowered Biz Radio to provide a real-time resource for businesses nationwide. The show features in-depth interviews with today’s top media, sales and marketing professionals. Topics cover everything from maximizing limited marketing/PR budgets to reaching diverse consumers to getting featured in top publications and on top websites, radio shows and TV programs.

item.title: Speaking UP! Helping Victims of Domestic Violence This Holiday Season - Oct 29,2009
item.description:
FEATURED GUEST: Mildred Muhammad, ex-wife of "DC Sniper" John Allen Muhammad. She will discuss her book "Scared Silent: when the One You Love Becomes the One You Fear," which details the abuse she suffered at his hands and how his deisre to harm her sparked the killing spree the nation has never forgotten. BrainPowered Biz Radio has partnered with the Donate to A Diva Holiday Campaign to help bring awareness to the plight of domestic violence. During National Domestic Violence Awareness month, Cynthia Tawiah, founder of Diva By Cindy, will chat with directors from women’s shelters in the Maryland, Washington, DC and Virginia areas in order to share the very real situations facing the women forced to reside in these shelters. Cindy will be also be joined by authors of bestselling memoirs who have shared their gripping stories of their experiences with domestic abuse to provide insight and hope to listeners who may be going through similar situations or know someone who is. This episode also features Minister Pam Bell of Serenity Counseling, who will share how to mental heal from the scars of experiencing domestic violence. Tune in for these gripping and uplifting stories of "Healing After Hurt."

item.title: The Beauty Biz Roundup: Growth & Opportunity in the Beauty Industry - Jun 24,2009
item.description:
Certain sectors of the global beauty industry are seeing growth despite the recession. Find out about the overall health of the beauty industry and opportunities for companies seeking to enter the field, how companies can remain competitive in the global beauty market and how social media is affecting the beauty landscape. BrainPowered Biz Radio will sit down with Jeff Falk of GCI (Global Cosmetics Industry) Magazine, Daniela Ciocan of Cosmoprof North America, Shalonda Armstrong of Design Essentials and Michelle Breyer of NaturallyCurly.com and Curlstylist.com to discuss industry best practices in this still-strong sector.

beauty | hair haircare | business marketing social media | ethnic hair black hair | cosmetics makeup

item.title: Remaining Resilient: A Chat with Sales and Leadership Expert Colleen Stanley - May 11,2009
item.description:
Join BrainPowered Biz Radio as we delve into what it takes to make sales bounce back from the today’s economic challenges. We’ll be chatting with Colleen Stanley, sales and leadership expert and nationally syndicated columnist, on strategies to create resiliency within your sales structure. You’ll hear Colleen’s expertise and insight on *New Method’s of Selling in Today’s Economy * Developing Highly Effective Sales Forces for the Information Age *The Power of Integrated Marketing on Sales Success

sales | recession | leadership development | integrated markeing | sales force development

item.title: Empowering Women-Owned Businesses in Today's Economy: A Chat With Cynthia Good of PINK Magazine - Apr 29,2009
item.description:
We'll be speaking with Cynthia Good, CEO, founding editor and co-owner of PINK Magazine on how women-owned businesses can transform their business models in today's economic climate. Listeners will benefit from Good’s insight and perspectives on: * Thriving and adapting in a changing economy; * Success factors for women-owned business; and *Connecting your brand with women consumers. She'll also share the type of information that makes it in PINK's pages--print and online! Submit your questions for Cynthia via our Facebook (http://tinyurl.com/dytgv9) or our Twitter pages (www.twitter.com/brainchildassoc).

Women-owned business | Entreprenuership | Public Relations | Marketing | Magazines
